Literature.Title: A Novel Antimicrobial Peptide Sp-LECin with Broad-Spectrum Antimicrobial Activity and Anti-Pseudomonas aeruginosa Infection in Zebrafish.
Literature.Author: Chen YC, Qiu W, Zhang W, Zhang J, Chen R, Chen F, Wang KJ

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Listeria monocytogenes CGMCC 1.10753(MIC=<3µM),Enterococcus faecium CGMCC 1.131(MIC=6µM),Enterococcus faecalis CGMCC 1.2135(MIC=12µM),Staphylococcus aureus CGMCC 1.2465(MIC=48µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis CGMCC 1.4260(MIC=24µM),Bacillus subtilis CGMCC 1.3358(MIC=6µM),Acinetobacter baumannii CGMCC 1.6769(MIC=12µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa CGMCC 1.2387(MIC=24µM),Pseudomonas stutzeri CGMCC 1.1803(MIC=<3µM),Pseudomonas fluorescens CGMCC 1.3202(MIC=12µM),Escherichia coli CGMCC 1.2389(MIC=48µM),Shigella flexneri CGMCC 1.1868(MIC=6µM),Fusarium oxysporum CGMCC 3.6785(MIC=24µM),Fusarium solani CGMCC 3.5840(MIC=24µM),Fusarium graminearum CGMCC 3.3490(MIC=48µM),Aspergillus niger CGMCC 3.316(MIC=24µM),Aspergillus fumigatus CGMCC 3.5835(MIC=24µM),Aspergillus ochraceus CGMCC 3.5830(MIC=24µM)
